intro: Ovieda picardae, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, bright orange to red inflorescences that resemble the sun, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the genus Tithonia in the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Ovieda picardae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are hairy and heart-shaped, while its stems are sturdy and erect.
